intro: Gymnotrix elegans, commonly known as the elegant gymnophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Gymnotrix elegans thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
